title: The Mandeville Parade Act
description: Category: statute | Source: https://laws.moj.gov.jm/library/statute/the-mandeville-parade-act | Legal areas: Local Government

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The Parish Council of the parish of Manchester may Powerto
make regulations for the proper management and preser- make   regu-
                                                        lationsas
vation of the Mandeville Parade, and may from time to Elze~lle
time alter, add to or rescind, any such regulations :   Parade.
   Provided always that no such regulations, or any altera-
tion or amendment thereof, shall be of any force or effect
until fourteen days after the same shall have been approved
by the Minister and published in the Gazette.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Any person doing any act in contravention of any regulations,
                                                                Breachof
regulation made by the Parish Council under this Act, penalty
and approved as aforesaid, shall, on summary conviction theref or.
be liable to a penalty not exceeding ten dollars, or in default
to imprisonment with or without hard labour for a term
not exceeding one month.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. Any constable, or other person specially appointed in Powerof
writing by the Chairman of the Parish Council, may law- arrest.
fully arrest without warrant any person wilfully and after
due warning contravening any regulation of the Council
which has been approved as aforesaid.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. Every person appointed in writing by the Chairman Powers,etc.,
to carry out the regulations of the Parish Council shall,
for the purposes of this Act, have the powers and privileges carry
                                                              regulations.
                                                                   out
of a constable of the Jamaica Constabulary.

Postingup      6. When rules and regulations have been approved by
of regula-
tions.       the Minister, the Parish Council aforesaid shall cause copies
             thereof to be painted on boards, and posted and kept posted
             up on two conspicuous places on or near the Parade.
